image.altText: Roger Rogerson

props.synopsis: The former police officer was awarded at least a dozen accolades for his work on some of the country's most high-profile cases before turning to a life of crime and spending his final days behind bars.

title.children: Disgraced former top detective Roger Rogerson dies serving prison sentence for murder

image.altText: A number of people cross an intersection in Brisbane's CBD. Behind them are office buildings.

props.synopsis: Would you quit your job if your boss told you that you must go back into the office?Â Or would you adhere to the new rule, especially if it meant a potential pay rise? This is a question more workers may have to contemplate in the year ahead as employers ask their staff to stop working from home.

title.children: Is a full-time return to the office inevitable for many workers as employers gain 'more power'?

image.altText: Victoria Azarenka holds her fist above her head in celebration

props.synopsis: Victoria Azarenka's bid to keep her Australian Open run going kicks off day nine, with Daniil Medvedev, Alexander Zverev and Carlos Alcaraz all in action today. Follow live.

title.children: Two-time champ eyes QF berth as Australian Open fourth-round action continues

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Dayana Yastremska takes the first set
Are there any Aussies in action today?
De Minaur's despair at heartbreaking loss

image.altText: a composite image of a young surflisaver swimming to a cave and then walking out of a cave with three boys

props.synopsis: Saskia Rundle Trowbridge, 16, braved rough seas and climbed rocks to help free three teenage boys trappedÂ in a cave at the Warriewood Blowhole, with one suffering head injuries.

title.children: Stuck cords, concussion and a cave: The daring three-person ocean rescue by a teenage surf lifesaver

image.altText: Israeli soldiers move on armored personnel carriers (APC) near the Israeli-Gaza border.

props.synopsis: Israel's prime minister criticises a Hamas proposal to end the war in Gaza that would have involved the release of Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners and left the militant group in power.Â

title.children: Netanyahu rejects Hamas proposal to end Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: A stack of takeaway coffee cups.

props.synopsis: Only 12 per cent of the 800,000 tonnes of plastic waste generated in NSW every year is recycled and the EPA is looking for ways to improve those numbers.

title.children: Takeaway coffee cups could be next as crackdown on single-use plastics continues in NSW

image.altText: Ron DeSantis gesticulates in front of an American flag

props.synopsis: The Florida governor saysÂ he lacks a "clear path to victory"Â and endorses Donald Trump's candidacy for the nomination.

title.children: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis quits presidential campaign

image.altText: Two hands reach out and pass a condom between them against a beige plain background.

props.synopsis: Since the female contraceptive pill was introduced more than 60 years ago, scientists have sought a similar solution for men.Â The reason for the delay, according to experts, is not unresolved science but money.

title.children: The hunt for male contraception is nearly overÂ â but a predictable problem stands in the way

image.altText: A depiction of Tropical Low O5U in the Coral Sea offÂ the Queensland coast captured on Sunday January 21, 2024.

props.synopsis: A Coral Sea storm could become powerful enough to be declared a cyclone by tomorrow, the Bureau of Meteorology has warned, bringing with it heavy rains and a potential storm surge as it crosses the Queensland coast.

title.children: Severe cyclone to hit Queensland Thursday, with heavy rain to linger across state into weekend

image.altText: Alex de Minaur walks off Rod Laver Arena at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: After squandering a two-sets-to-one lead, Alex de Minaur is left to reflect on what might have been after going down in an epic clash with Andrey Rublev in the fourth round at Melbourne Park.

title.children: 'Absolutely devastated': De Minaur bows out as serve falters in five-set loss at Australian Open

image.altText: A criss-crossed letter

props.synopsis: When Colleen Dorahyâs mother died, a neatly folded criss-crossed letter dated 1879 was discovered among her belongings â marked only with the author's initials.

title.children: Deciphering a criss-crossed letter to solve the mystery of its author

image.altText: An old white man with a blue sleeveless top, a hat and glasses stands in a flood damaged room near Menindee.

props.synopsis: For Paul Grose, damage to his home during flooding in late 2022 was "devastating". He hopes a recent review into the event will help authorities prevent others from experiencing the same fate.

title.children: Angry Menindee locals still cleaning up more than a year after flooding

image.altText: Peter Walsh wears a dark jacket, white collared shirt and blue striped tie and sits in an ABC radio studio.

props.synopsis: The Victorian opposition says concerns over the state's cultural heritage laws are behind its decision to retract its support for a state-based treaty.

title.children: Victorian treaty bipartisanship ruptures as opposition withdraws its support

image.altText: Happy border collie pup runs in lush paddock towards camera

props.synopsis: It might be hard to imagine, but sheepdog trials were once so popular in Australia they were broadcast on TV each weekend. But if you're new to sheepdog trials, let's take a few steps back and revisit the basics with Muster Dog breeder Mick Hudson.

title.children: Fallen in love with the idea of having a farm dog? It's not as easy as you might think

image.altText: Locals watch as a fires come over the hill

props.synopsis: MegafiresÂ were once rare, but they are becoming increasingly common, and 2023 is clear evidence of that.Â Experts say the events are being made worse by climate change. ButÂ how much are wildfires contributing to climate change themselves?Â

title.children: Canadian fires pumped triple the country's annual emissions into the atmosphere. What does that mean for the climate?

image.altText: A collection of road signs pointing towards Wilton, Picton and Campbelltown

props.synopsis: A major road linking south-west Sydney to Wollongong has received NSW government approval for a long-awaited upgrade that accounts for impacts on a growing koala colony.

title.children: Major upgrade of road linking south-west Sydney to thousands of new homes approved after five-year wait

image.altText: Meshilin Marrogi smiles in front of a graphic of a blue sky.

props.synopsis: A police information caravan will be stationedÂ in Melbourne's north as detectives identify car linked to gruesome mausoleum burglary.

title.children: Police release image of car as part of investigation into underworld mausoleum robbery

image.altText: A large gas plant with lots of metal infrastructure.

props.synopsis: WA's policy of preventing gas produced onshore from being exported was hailed as a masterstroke during the east coast's energy crisis. But with pressure to ease those restrictions coming from billionaires, some say that could lead to disaster.Â

title.children: 'Disaster' fears for WA's gas supply as billionaires seek to cash in on lucrative export market

image.altText: Rebecca Ray, with short brown hair and floral shirt, smiles widely sitting on desk, with dog at her legs looking up at her.

props.synopsis: The discomfort of change can be better than the discomfort of not changing, and living a dissatisfied life. It's a lesson these people learnt through personal experience.

title.children: Rebecca's job was making her unhappy so she made a huge change. Here's her advice for doing the same

image.altText: The government has reached an agreement to boost domestic gas supply

props.synopsis:
Gas companies Woodside and Esso will supply extra gas to the east coast energy market in return for receiving higher prices, the federal government has announced.
Â

title.children: Government announces extra gas supply for east coast but households may not benefit

image.altText: A finger next to a small white flower.

props.synopsis: A bushwalker who came across a small flower in a Tasmanian national park and snapped a photo did not realise she'd made a significant discovery at the time.

title.children: Super rare dwarf violet 'hiding for 200 years right next to a walking track' discovered in Tasmania

image.altText: An AI-generated images of Argentine presidential candidateÂ Sergio Massa riding a lion.Â

props.synopsis: Experts warn that with elections to be held in about 50 countries this year â including the world's biggest democracies in India, the United States, and Indonesia â the proliferation of easy-to-use AI tools is set to lead toÂ a "tsunami of disinformation".Â

title.children: How the democratisation of AI tools is threatening democracy around the world with 'tsunami of disinformation'

image.altText: Cruz Hewitt plays a forehand at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: With his legendary father watching on from the stands, 15-year-old Cruz Hewitt competes in the boys' singles tournament at the Australian Open for the first time.

title.children: Tennis great Lleyton Hewitt's son Cruz makes Australian Open debut

image.altText: The Charging Bull statue in New York's financial district

props.synopsis: US shares hit a record high despite rate cut bets being further scaled back amid economic optimism and comments from a voting Federal Reserve official describing rate cut talk as "premature". Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Wall Street hits record highs despite 'premature' talk of interest rate cuts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Liontown Resources slumps 20% as it scales back lithium project, faces funding setback

image.altText: Turbines in an offshore wind farm in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Advocates say federal environment laws could be overhauled to allow consideration of the potential for projects to mitigate climate change â like a knocked-back proposal for an offshore wind farm in Victoria.

title.children: Federal rejection of Victorian renewable energy project a bump in the road, proponents say

image.altText: Hundreds of sheep are penned at the Bendigo Livestock Exchange

props.synopsis: Livestock producers say unreliable long-term weather forecasts have played havoc with sheep and cattle prices, after farmers made business decisions based on media reports.

title.children: Farmers frustrated after BOM's El NiÃ±o forecast proves costly

image.altText: A silhouette of a person vaping with an orange light behind the vapour cloud.

props.synopsis: Graphic anti-smoking advertisements on television remain in the minds of Australians and were successful in lowering smoking rates. But campaigns around the risks of vaping might not be hitting home with many young people, a researcher says.

title.children: Australia is facing a new public health crisis in vaping. So, how can we help teens stop?

image.altText: A group of soldiers walk through a wrecked, dusty street.

props.synopsis: The grim milestone came as the UN secretary-general condemned Israeli forces for the extent of civilian deaths, and Israel's cabinet approved a plan for tax funds earmarked for the Gaza Strip to be held by Norway.

title.children: Palestinian death toll in Gaza surpasses 25,000 as Israelis grow increasingly divided over best way to free hostages

image.altText: Man crying on the ground

props.synopsis: It came as Russia's largest liquefied natural gas producer said work at a terminal had been suspended following a fire caused by "external influence".

title.children: At least 25 dead in Ukrainian strike on marketplace in Russia-annexed city of Donetsk

image.altText: A man using a blowtorch to heat a pipe near a stairway

props.synopsis: Russia's dilapidated infrastructure is struggling to keep up with plummeting temperatures. Heating is a major concern and freezing residents are taking to social media to vent about their "fight for survival".

title.children: Russia's central heating system is failing, and experts warn an 'avalanche of disasters' is coming
